content.title: Reperfusion Injury
content.description: Systemic and local complications of revascularization after prolonged ischemia

key_concepts.details: Release of myoglobin, potassium, lactate, inflammatory mediators into systemic circulation
Metabolic acidosis, hyperkalemia, myoglobinuria, acute kidney injury, ARDS, cardiac arrest
Bicarbonate, mannitol, adequate hydration; monitor for compartment syndrome
Prophylactic fasciotomy for prolonged ischemia (>4-6 hours)

content.clinical_significance: Major cause of mortality after successful revascularization
content.statement: Reperfusion Injury is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Acute-Limb-Ischemia that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
